author.name: Bryan Berry - Nathen Harvey - Matt Ray

entry.title: Community Summit - Recap
entry.content:
Join us as we recap the Opscode Community Summit.

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • John Dyer twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • JJ Asghar twitter, github
  • Ian Meyer twitter, github
  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Show Note

During the original recording of the show we went a bit off topic and there was a brief discussion that was not in keeping with the spirit of this show. We have removed about three minutes from the video on YouTube and from the audio recording.

Outline

  • Linux Block IO: Introducing Multi-queue SSD Access on Multi-core Systems
  • Introductions
  • JJ's Chef Book
  • Diversity in Tech
  • Mentoring
  • Chef 12 Features
  • Version Roles
  • Julian Dunn: Chef Roles Arenâ€™t Evil
  • Top #opschef issues discussion, ordered
  • "Best Practices"
  • Shuhari
  • Learn Chef
  • Omnitruck API
  • metarepo
  • sensu
  • chef-monitor
  • Multi-node testing & Vagabond
    • vagabond
    • BDDing your infrastructure with Vagabond: A Big Nerd Ranch Tech Talk
    • Matt Ray: Vagabond Overview
    • Valiently Validating Vagrant wit Vagabond by Will Farrington
  • Hallway Track
  • Windows and Windows Support
  • AWS re:Invent 2013
  • Best in Show

Download

  • Audio
  • Video

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show and the newsletter are sponsored, in part, by Opscode.

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.title: Community Summit - Day 1
entry.content:
Join Nathen as he discusses the first day of the Opscode Community Summit with Tom Duffield and John Dyer.

Check the github-based wiki for notes from many of the sessions.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download

entry.title: Community Summit Day Two
entry.content:
Show Date: Wednesday, October 24

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download

Panel

  • Fletcher Nichol github, twitter
  • Seth Vargo github, twitter
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter
  • Jeff Hulten github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Nathen sits down with Fletcher Nichol (@fnichol), Seth Vargo (@sethvargo), Mike Fiedler (@mikefiedler), and Jeff Hulten (@jhulten) to talk about day two of the Chef Community Summit. We meant to chat for about 20 minutes but this conversation ended taking about an hour. Enjoy!

Topics include:

  • Google+ Hangouts
  • Bug smashing
  • Contributing to the new Docs Site
  • Cookbook Curation
  • Cookbook Name Squatting
  • TDDing tmux
  • Workflow and versioning cookbooks
  • Commitments to make knife plugins installable with knife
  • Exception Handlers

Session Summaries

Follow all the updates from the summit on the Opscode Wiki

Download

Download Chef Summit Day Two Recap - Download here

entry.title: Community Summit - Day One
entry.content:
Show Date: Tuesday October 23

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Google+ Hangout
  • Twitter hashtag
  • Session Summaries
  • Download

Panel

  • Jamie Winsor, github, twitter
  • Eric G. Wolfe github, twitter
  • Seth Vargo github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Nathen sits down with Eric Wolfe (@atomic_penguin), Seth Vargo (@sethvargo), and Jamie Winsor (@resetexistence) to talk about day one of the Chef Community Summit.

Topics include:

  • Open space format of the summit
  • Various sessions of the day including:
    • New Chef Documentation - check out docs.opscode.com
    • Workflow
    • Continuous Deployment and Continuous Integration
    • Testing your Infrastructure
    • Chef on Windows

Google+ Hangout

If you're not at Chef Summit, join us on Wednesday for a Google+ Hangout Chef session. Follow @foodfightshow or Nathen to be notified when we get started. We're planning on starting the hangout at 13:00 UTC.

Twitter Hashtag

Most people are using #chefsummit as the hashtag for updates from the summit. Update your filters, twitter clients, etc.

Session Summaries

Follow all the updates from the summit on the Opscode Wiki
